definition: to get married and start a career (idiom)/to settle down/to establish oneself
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
surname Cheng

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 傢伙|家伙[jia1 huo5]
surname Li
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
surname Ye
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: And a key step to becoming that man is to find a wife and raise a family.
sentences.chinese: 成为那样的男人需要经历的关键的一步是成家立业。

sentences.english: I am 56 years old this year. My children have families of their own.
sentences.chinese: 今年56岁，现在孩子们都们各自成家立业了。

sentences.english: he has like, a family there.
sentences.chinese: 他已经在日本成家立业了。

sentences.english: After years of effort, he finally bought a house and settled in this city.
sentences.chinese: 经过多年的努力，他终于在这个城市成家立业了。

definition: to settle down and get married (of a man)/to become a recognized expert
to get married and have kids/to start a family
stable household, established profession (idiom); settled and comfortably off
aged thirty (see 三十而立)
to be successful in business/professional success
to take a wife/to get married (man)
to get married (of woman)
lit. to play with one's grandchildren while eating candy (idiom)/fig. to enjoy a happy and leisurely old age
to bear and raise children
to give birth to a child or children
to get oneself a wife/to take a daughter-in-law
thirty years old and therefore independent (idiom, from Confucius)
to win success and recognition (idiom)
children/sons and daughters
at the knee (in reference to children)/(salutation used in letters to parents or grandparents)
no longer a child (idiom)
